personal.name: JANICE A. OWUSU
personal.title: Geomatics Professional & GIS Specialist
slogans: The earth does not belong to us — we belong to the earth.
Not all those who wander are lost — some are just collecting ground truth data.
A woman with a map can change the world.
Where there is no data, there is no justice.
From Asamankese to Vancouver — every coordinate tells a story.
The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
Do not go where the path may lead; go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
personal.about: Geomatics professional, with a passion for using spatial technology to solve real-world environmental and social challenges. My work spans GIS analysis, LiDAR processing, remote sensing, and field surveying — with a particular focus on combating illegal mining, resolving land disputes, and promoting sustainable land management in Ghana and beyond. I bring hands-on experience from telecommunications, data analytics, and community-based mapping projects. I am driven by the belief that geospatial tools can empower communities and drive meaningful, lasting change.

experience.title: Junior Intelligent Network Operations Analyst
experience.description: Managed data quality control for telecommunications systems serving 6M+ subscribers. Developed Python scripts (Paramiko, Pandas) to automate data collection and monitoring. Processed Call Data Records (CDRs) and contributed to the ETL pipeline for a customer loyalty platform. Produced weekly technical reports analyzing system performance.
experience.tools: Python, Pandas, Paramiko, Kafka, Nokia Surepay, Microsoft Excel

experience.title: Data Analyst Intern
experience.description: Processed large-scale datasets for computer vision and transportation analytics. Conducted quality assurance on field-collected data and prepared annotated datasets for AI model training. Contributed to model evaluation pipelines for detecting moving vehicles and pedestrians.

experience.title: Geomatic Engineering Intern
experience.description: Conducted field surveys using GPS and total stations for cadastral mapping and boundary delineation. Prepared site plans and technical drawings using AutoCAD for municipal planning projects. Performed spatial analysis of land records to identify encroachment patterns and documentation gaps. Integrated GPS field data into GIS databases and created maps for land-use planning.
experience.tools: GPS/GNSS, Total Stations, AutoCAD, ArcGIS, QGIS

projects.name: Forest Canopy Gap Dynamics – Airborne LiDAR Analysis
projects.description: Processed multi-temporal airborne LiDAR point cloud data spanning 10 years (2012–2022) to assess forest canopy gap dynamics and structural changes. Created derived products including Digital Elevation Models (DEMs) and Canopy Height Models (CHMs) using R-based geospatial workflows and spatial statistics.

projects.name: Campus Navigation System – KNUST
projects.description: Co-developed a web-based GIS navigation application for over 85,000 campus users at KNUST, featuring real-time routing, building search, and points of interest. Conducted extensive GPS field data collection and managed the spatial database of road networks and campus infrastructure.

projects.name: Community Land Documentation & GPS Training Initiative
projects.description: Coordinated workshops in Asamankese training 100+ community members on GPS navigation and spatial data collection tools (Locus, Mappit). Created cadastral maps from field-collected GPS data to support land boundary documentation and help resolve approximately 10 reported land dispute cases.

projects.name: GSuite Geospatial Application
projects.description: Collaborated in the development of a web-based application for geospatial data processing and visualization within the GSuite environment. Implemented functionalities to process spatial data, simplify complex geospatial workflows, and improve data-driven decision-making for users.

education.degree: Master of Geomatics for Environmental Management (MGEM)
education.details: MCF Scholarship | Capstone: Multi-temporal airborne LiDAR analysis of forest canopy gap dynamics (2012–2022). Relevant coursework: Remote Sensing, Spatial Statistics & Modeling, GIS for Environmental Management, R and Python Programming.

education.institution: Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology
education.degree: Bachelor of Science (First Class Honours) – Geomatic Engineering
education.details: Thesis: Design and Implementation of a Campus Navigation System at KNUST. Relevant courses: GIS, Remote Sensing, Geodetic Surveying, GNSS, Cartography, Photogrammetry.

certifications.name: Integrate Data with the FME Platform
